intro: Selliguea stracheyi, commonly known as the Strachey's moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. The plant has a short, upright stem with dense, overlapping leaves that are usually green to reddish in color. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores when mature. Selliguea stracheyi is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
